title: The issue isn't Kai'Sa having no personality...

replies.body: The problem is that we have no idea how Kai'Sai survived in the most horrifying realm of runeterra's universe, the Void itself without going insane.
By becoming calm, cool headed, stoic and grim? Not everyone goes the same cartoony insane fiction overuses.

The Void is a horrific, inhospitable dimension, where presumably monsters like Cho'gath, Kha'zix and Rek'sai are commonplace. A plane of existence so alien that _looking into it_ drives mortals insane. This is new lore, not just old.

The fact that she survived that world (FOR YEARS) and somehow emerged with the disposition of a bored starbucks cashier is the most cartoonish thing I can think of.

> [{quoted}](name=TwitchesBeCrazy,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xVwz4Uza,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-23T03:56:37.981+0000)
>
> The Void is a horrific, inhospitable dimension, where presumably monsters like Cho'gath, Kha'zix and Rek'sai are commonplace. A plane of existence so alien that _looking into it_ drives mortals insane. This is new lore, not just old.
> 
> The fact that she survived that world (FOR YEARS) and somehow emerged with the disposition of a bored starbucks cashier is the most cartoonish thing I can think of.

You said it perfectly.

Nothing I can find actually says people go insane from looking at the void. It's a strange and terrifying place of organic machines (think H.R. Geiger but with less penises), but that's all the lore says. Malzahar didn't go insane from looking at the void, neither did Kassadin. Remember that anything that's not on the Universe page might as well be non-canonical, and there's not a lot about the Void on there.

> [{quoted}](name=TwitchesBeCrazy,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xVwz4Uza,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-23T03:56:37.981+0000)

> The fact that she survived that world (FOR YEARS) and somehow emerged with the disposition of a bored starbucks cashier is the most cartoonish thing I can think of.

You know, I agree with you with most of it except for the simple fact that, after a certain point, you regain sanity.

I don't mean you regain sanity like nothing ever happened.  You regain sanity because the madness became so strong that it reversed into the opposite direction. Give enough time, and the apocalyptic abnormal becomes the new normal.  If she stayed just long enough, she wouldn't come out  going "Wubba lubba dub dub" unless she completely forgot how to speak.
ive always thought of the void as W40k's warp. a place so twisted and horrible that it drives most people insane, or it just straight up kills you.

> [{quoted}](name=royalpaste,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xVwz4Uza,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2018-02-23T09:09:42.508+0000)
>
> ive always thought of the void as W40k's warp. a place so twisted and horrible that it drives most people insane, or it just straight up kills you.

And yet the Space Wolves suvrive, thrive, and conquer in the warp. The warp itself isn't inherently evil, yes its filled with bad creatures and Chaos gods, but the warp is also used by humans, aelderi, etc...

The reason I mentioned the Space Wolves is, because Lemann Russ and his elite group of followers went into the Warp and fight it succesfully. Mentioned group came out of the warp to fight again in the human universe according to the lore.

I don't get "stoic and grim" from her VO.  I got a vibe more like a bored 14 year old being dragged to a family reunion and forced to play a game with his younger cousins.  I shall show this in a quick little screenplay I have JUST WRITTEN UP!  The part of Kai shall be played by Anthony, a surly 14 year old stuck playing with his more excited cousin, Tim.


Anthony:  (deadpan and disinterested, holding a plastic gun)  "Bam, I shot you Tim.  You're dead."

Tim.  (Wearing a power-rangers outfit)  "You're supposed to be the bad guy!  Stop sounding like you want to go inside and play on your phone!"

Anthony:  "I DO want to go inside and play on my phone."

Tim:  "...."

Anthony:  "...."

Tim:  (Just as bored and disinterested now)  "Ow.  I am dead."  

(Tim half-assedly falls to the ground.  Anthony shrugs and goes inside while pulling out his phone)

Anthony:  (Deadpan)  K, good game.  Cya.

Fin.
Doesn't sound the slightest bit bored to me. Maybe you just are not used to hearing regular women talk, only flanderized personalities in video games.

Kai'Sa is not a regular women. 

Also, I know plenty of regular women, and most of them are more excitable than this, even if only slightly.

Well she is not excitable no. She is calm and focused, she had to be to survive. Normal people go crazy from the void which is why they don't survive.

But my point is she sounds like a real person, not a flanderized stereotype.

Well, my point is that some emphasis is necessary based on the nature of it being a video game, one that isn't focused on story (at least not through gameplay) and a fantasy game at that. She's not a real person, she's not even meant to exist in the real world. Her job is to be engaging on some level, and while I'm not saying a calmer character can't be engaging, she needs more than that. Ivern, Taliyah, Jhin, Camille and the Lamb half of Kindred are all calmer characters in some aspect, yet obviously they have a lot more than just calm and/or focused going for them. 

My point is also that there is a middle ground where she's not completely dull and uninteresting, but she's not a caricature either. 

Heck, I think making her a full-on deadpan character a la something from an anime would have worked better. It just feels like they had this really vague direction that changed a few times and the end result feels like it didn't emphasize anything at all, even important aspects of her character and so it falls flat.

Love how everyone is an expert online about how things should be. YT and reddit have positive responses to her, so do some of us "unpopulars" on the boards. The only place I see negative responses are the boards, a place full of hipsters who only like the "unique", the flanderized, the monsters and the extreme. And who hate attractive fem characters and mass appeal. Jhin doesn't appeal to me but this character does, with 140+ champions not everyone is going to like all of them, not every release is for you.

I have been waiting for a fem void human since S1 and she couldn't be more perfect.

Never claimed I was an expert. This is my opinion, although I think it's at least based in some kind of logic. It must have been a pretty good argument since you didn't respond directly to any of my points.

Youtube, Boards and Reddit all represent minority of the playerbase, so basing any "but people like it!" statements on them is always going to be inaccurate. Further, Reddit generally doesn't focus a lot on Story and Visuals, most popular posts are about gameplay and esports (generally, obviously not a hard and fast rule) and are we really using Youtube comments and like/dislike bar to gauge anything? We all know the Youtube comments section is a cesspool by nature. 

I get it, not every character appeals to everyone. I and many others just had high hopes for the concept of "human escapes from years of living in the Void", and we are disappointed on almost every level. If you like her, then whatever. I don't dislike her. I just think she's disappointing. 

I don't see why I shouldn't have high expectations when Riot just knocked it out of the park with characters like Swain and Zoe (visuals and story-wise, I don't want to get into gameplay stuff).

Because they knocked it out of the park with this one too it just doesn't appeal to you. It is like asking a Star Trek diehard how they liked the latest Star Wars.

And I don't have time to write walls or text like I used to nor would I if I had that time I would be playing video games with it.

There's a difference between "doesn't appeal to me" and "I don't think this character was well-executed". Champions that don't appeal to me is someone like Xayah, who's personality I dislike and motivations I think are hypocritical, but the difference is she is _supposed_ to be like that, and I have no problem with how she was executed on. She just isn't my cup of tea. Skarner's newer lore: I'm not crazy about it, but I take no issue with it from a quality or execution standpoint. Galio's new lore and look I hate--for reasons that I won't get into detail--but I can see the appeal and understand when other people like it. Its very high quality and delivers effectively on the fantasy they chose for him. 

With Kai'Sa, this is more a combination of "I think the direction was weak" and "I see what they were going for, can see the appeal, but think they failed at delivering on that concept". 

It's less like asking a Trekkie how they liked the new Star Wars and more like asking a Sonic the Hedgehog fan how they liked Sonic Boom (it was terrible).

Nah she's more like Sonic Adventure 2, some people say it's terrible because it's a 3D Sonic game and those should never exist in their opinion, While others think it's amazing and wish they would make a third one.

It is not like either of those things... because it is not a game, it is a character who is good or bad based on how well she is written and executed.  Sonic games can fail for multitudes of reasons beyond writing and characterization (though they can certainly fail for those reasons too).

Also, no one is saying Kai'sa is a failure because "calm or collected characters should never exists".  They are mostly saying that her characterization is weak, doesn't come across well or really fails to live up to her intense backstory.  You clearly like her, and that's fine... but you also clearly don't seem to understand characterization and how to discuss it or what the properties of a character even ARE.  

And that's ALSO fine.  You can enjoy the character just fine without analyzing her like a writer or a critc might.  But if that is the case, stop acting like a writer or a critic and trying to defend her on grounds that you do not freaking understand.  Just... agree to disagree man.  It's not like Riot is gonna change her, so you're going to get exactly the character you seem to like.  So just let the people who enjoy rambling about lore and writing and shit do it and go play her.

Agree to disagree on this then... because I think you're projecting these ideas onto an otherwise milquetoast, blank-slate of a character.

The fact that you have a lot of "If" and "we have to assume" in there is kind of what I'm saying.  They could have defined her AND the void a lot better with just her VO.  The mere fact that you flat out said "if we delve deeper" is the issue.  It's a VO in a game where story is light... is there a reason why they couldn't have cranked her VO up a little and added some more lines to let us know what she was like, what the void was like and how she dealt with it and came out the way she did?  They put in about ten different ways she can say "I shot you.  Ha." on her W and about ten more ways she can say "go away bug" when she attacks a void monster... could we not have ditched one of those generic "I'll get you" lines and gotten a soft "It's funny how unsettling normal can be when you're used to weird".  Not that exact line obviously, but something that brought that across.

And no, I will NOT excuse the catsuit and make up.  If her VO didn't leave me grasping at straws to figure out what kind of character she even IS, I might... but since it left me with nothing her visuals matter to me a lot.  Hell, I'd say they should tell a story in and of themselves.  Looking at SO many other champs tells a story.  Darius is a big, brutal man.   He's got the grim-looking armor, the chopped short hair and the intimidating weapon.  Zoe is a childish goofball.  Swain is a powerful, sinister aristocrat with an obviously inhuman arm.  They all come across pretty well just from looking at them... how they look and how they move.  

Look at Kai's splash art and you'd think... she's a hot chick in a bio-tech lookin' suit.  If you told me she was a space pirate come here to steal magic and sell on the intergalactic market, it would fit.  If you told me she was Samas Aran's cousin, here to hunt down alien criminals, it would fit.  If you told me she was a fashion model that got tricked into putting on a high-tech suit that would "keep her thin and pretty forever" and she can't take it off now... it would fit.  If you told me... well, you get the point.  Her visuals do not convey much about her, and in a lot of cases only raise questions when you bring up her actual backstory.  Why is she so pretty and normal looking?  Why is she so put together?  Why is she flashing cleavage and wearing make up?

The real answer to those questions is "so teenage boys will buy her"... and that's a good enough reason for the marketing department, but the writing department should be PISSED.  That is NOT how you write a good character... and it is EXACTLY what went wrong with her IMO.  It's pretty obvious that their goal with her was NOT to make an interesting character that felt real... but to make a broadly APPEALING character without much people could dislike about her.  No intense traits or actions.  No moody edgelord wangst, no bitchy demeanor, no "helpless woman syndrome" or PTSD style broken/shaken will, no alien mindset or physical features.  Everything that might make her in ANY way unappealing to someone or offend someone was filed off, save the generic sex appeal that EVERY character in media has be default unless some company wants to make a point about being "progressive" by tossin' out an Illaoi or a Zarya.  She was filed down to a shape they figured no one could hate, and because of it she has nothin about her that makes her interesting or exciting.  Her backstory is the only part of her that's got teeth to it... and it's the part that current in-game Kai may as well not have had, for how little it's changed her.  Christ, Akali did the "calm but deadly I might have some emotional issues but they're ones I'm in control of" thing a looong time ago.  Did ya know that?  I'll bet you didn't... because Akali is an old champ with very few lines that explain that.

And that is how Kai is going to.  A functional kit with a pretty suit, a pretty face and no god-damned character.  Oh, there's a story about how much character she's got coming soon, I'm sure.  But if you need to do research to find out what she's like... I'm calling that a failure to portray your character as much as if you needed to read a book to understand enough about a character in a movie to enjoy that character.  There should be SOMETHING in the movie... or in this case, the game... that gives the audience a grounding on who she is, what she feels and what she's like.

She's so much a blank slate tho that... it worked.  People see her, like the design or the background or the kit or just her tits... and say "well, I think she's like _________" and just go with that.  She was made to headcanon her.  Like a cardboard cut out or a body pillow you can ascribe your own feelings to.  Of course she's a fragile soul that barely managed to endure.  Don't like that?  Of course she's a hardened badass that burst out of hell without looking back.  No?  Like 'em frosty?  Of course she's an emotionally deadened woman with alien impulses who no longer understands this thing called love.  

You can slip her around all manners of interpretations of what you feel her character is like a pretty suit and then hug the shit out of it.  Or admire it.  Or fap.  Whatever you're into.  Because they wanted her to have broad appeal at the expense of characterization.. so she can be exactly what you want her to be.

> [{quoted}](name=The Whamboozler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xVwz4Uza,comment-id=0001000000010000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-24T21:54:51.448+0000)
> So just let the people who enjoy rambling about lore and writing and shit do it and go play her.

I wish more people would understand this. We care about this stuff, probably too much, this is our coping mechanism to deal with the disappointment. And considering Riot encourages dialogues like this, we are going to critique and ramble away. No matter what. It's just what we do.

Implying Star Trek fans can't have an opinion on star wars... or that their opinions are invalid because they're a bigger fan of a different show?

Nevermind that there is a HUGE overlap in the fanbase of both because they have a lot in common compared to say.... Lord of the Rings and Taken.  

If your logic for why you enjoy the character is as off-kilter as the logic you use to form your arguments, I think I'm beginning to see the problem here.  You like her and thus you do not CARE about logic, or if it makes sense, or if anyone else likes it.  Your like is as illogical as your attempts have been to defend it... and frankly... that's fine.  No one is saying you can't like her.  No one is saying you need a REASON to like her.  Go ahead and like her.

But stop acting like the people who dislike her or point out missteps in her characterization are wrong when you don't have a leg to stand on and your attempts to prove your point have been nothing but grasping at straws without understanding what you're saying or if it makes any goddamned sense.
Someone disagrees with you and you can't explain why you're right?  Just point out that people agree with you and appeal to popularity.  BAM!  Logic fallacies are GREAT!

> [{quoted}](name=AbiwonKenabi,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=xVwz4Uza,comment-id=0001000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-23T16:26:20.548+0000)
> 
> Heck, I think making her a full-on deadpan character a la something from an anime would have worked better. It just feels like they had this really vague direction that changed a few times and the end result feels like it didn't emphasize anything at all, even important aspects of her character and so it falls flat.

This.  I'd have also been fine with "I cut off my emotions" Kai'sa.  A little cliche?  Meh... everything's been done before.  But at least it would show how her ordeal affected her.  She's not even muted enough to pass as that tho... she's just dispassionate.  Like she's reading a script but doesn't have a real stake in what she's saying.  Her lines give me the feeling she's rather be doing something else than fighting bug monsters with her cool superpowers....

And even THAT would have been a better character.  A "I'm doing this not because I want to, but because I'm the only one who knows how serious a threat it is!".   That's.... basically Kassadin's character, but given that she's his daughter it would have made her a nice foil to him.  But she isn't like that either.

Honestly, I can't even really describe her as a character... I can state her backstory, but not what she's like other than "kinda calm".

She is NOT a real person.  She is a fictional superbeing with a background that is so utterly fantastic and intense EVEN FOR THE FANTASTIC SETTING THAT SHE IS A PART OF... that seeing her being so dispassionate and bland is REALLY jarring.

It is a character in a fictional setting that is larger than life and does larger than life things.  Maybe you like that she has the same tone and inflection of the bored girl at the starbucks that serves you coffee, but I expect a LITTLE more fervor put into her voice or a little more passion to her lines based on what she supposedly went through.  

And this is just my OPINION.  Clearly plenty of people like alien catsuit-wearing barista Kai'sa exactly as she is.  I just happen to disagree and find it a REALLY big waste of potential.

Yep, that's it.  I can't just differ in opinion of how they should have played her... I have to be a basement dwelling troll that's never seen a woman speak.  All I know of women is the squeeling they make in my goro hentai collection.

You nailed it.

nobody would survive a "horrifying realm" by going insane.
Why? because then they can just be easily tricked and killed/exploited.

Do veterans that got out of the war say stories about how crazy they were on the battle field? no, because the moment they would go crazy, they would take a bullet in the chest/head or worse.
You need to stay calm in a state of combat. Despite what hollywood teaches you.

Most people that suffer from post traumatic stress irl, suffer after they got out of the 'war zone'. When they can finally relax and get out of the "stone cold assassin mode".

This was a big thing around when Taliyah came out as well.

Kai'sa being less bombastic is something I think they can afford, now that longer lores are coming out and we have opportunities to flesh out characters outside of VO.
What?  Taliyah’s lines are great.  I hear plenty of emotion and even see into her character.

Exactly.

Taliyah's lines are good, people just didn't like them as much because they thought they were boring, because she's not as bombastic as other champions that were coming out around that time.

Taliyah's not exactly dripping with quips and one-liners, and that's okay.  Subdued is a fine character trait to have.  What I meant to say isn't that Taliyah's VO is bad, it's not.  Neither is Kai'sa's, IMO.  

They both just represent the ability to portray characters with more reserved personalities in game, which was previously difficult to do because a VO and a one page story was about all a character got for a large chunk of League's history, so Riot had to try and make these characters with big and bombastic personalities so you could pick up on their stories via VO alone.

{{champion:99}} DEMACIA!

****

While I understand your point, the difference between Taliyah and Kai’Sa is that you can feel everything the former feels through her lines.  The latter delivers... nothing but a bland chipper-ness.

I really like Taliyah's VO though. She's more reserved, but you get a lot of passion and emotion in every line. There's more subtle lines, of course, and some are silly. She's got a distinct personality.

I wouldn’t call her reserved, though.  She’s not Sion, but she doesn’t hold much back.

“Wait!  How did I _do_ that?”

“That... was... EPIC!”

“_Now_ they know who to learn from.”
Well, she's also not like Jinx levels of excited. She has a lot of calmer lines, too. She just has some lines where she's excited, too, depending on the situation.
The main problem is her voice actress, who did a poor job (or, at least, it didn't meet the standards we're used to).
I feel like it was more of a risk to try and create a different-than-usual character.  It landed with some and didn’t land with others
I feel like she's just forgettable, which is the last thing I expect out of any League champion. Hell not even Skarner (before he was busted) or Volibear are as forgettable as her.
Yes they are, they’re much more forgettable
I forget Volibear exists all the time.

Personality doesnt really indicate the popularity of a champion, Orrn{{champion:516}} has been forgotten completely, its mainly how they look like and Kai'Sa has a pretty design that appeals to the majority of the costumers
Tbf orn's personality is boring.
Which makes sense, based on his character. If anything, I'd swap out Ornn in the list for Jhin.
Hell no, jhin's like a storebrand bioshock character.

u w0t?

Jhin is EASILY one of the most memorable champions of the first decade of League's history, because of his gameplay, his thematic, and most of all, his personality. There's a reason he'd gotten 3 skins in the timespan of about a year. It's because his popularity comes not just from his gameplay and kit, but from his personality most of all. His obsession with "4", his humming, the way he weaves theatrics into his gameplay, etc.

yeh sure ma guy, he's popular. so? that doesn't mean he's all that amazing. Most of what he says doesn't make sense and is just there to sound cryptic and mysterious.
he's fun to play, but honestly that doesn't set him apart from most other champs.
"his humming", i'd say if there's any humming i remember best it's kindred's.
his obsession with 4 is kinda neat i guess but it's nothing special, just a cultural thing.
He uses some theatrical terms, well i guess heimer is a fucking genius design then? he uses scientific terms after all.

you're also making big claims about a champ being the most memorable to league's first decade while league itself isn't a decade old quite yet. If anyone i think teemo deserves that title as he's probably the best known league champ.

Memorable =/= amazing.

His personality isn't one we'd seen in League yet (some arguments could be made for Kindred, as they share similar thematics), and he'd risen to a fan-favorite in a short time. Sure, he uses theatrical terms, but what I mean is it accurately reflects his in-lore fights. His fantasy has been achieved accurately in-game, with the exception of shaping his targets' corpses. Warwick also does the same, achieving HIS lore fantasy in-game, which is why he's also memorable.

Please tell me where and when I said he was the most memorable within League's first decade?

> Jhin is EASILY one of the most memorable champions of the first decade of League's history,

Pretty sure this didn't have the "one of" added to it when i read it, but sure i'll take the hit, guess i misread it.

Still, there's plenty of champs that deliver on their fantasy, though there's some that don't. The only advantage jhin has is the fact that we can have more bells and wistles on our champs these days, like the music.

Yes, but Jhin's personality appeals to people. He's not a bland character like Taliyah is, nor does he lack the gameplay fantasy of ASol. His teasers, his voicelines, everything about him appealed to millions of people, even if they don't play him. I'm a mid/support main, and I absolutely abhor playing as ADC-- I'd rather skullfuck myself to death through my nostril-- but I fucking LOVE Jhin's quotes and personality.
